title: Choosing side
text: Choose a side to be the "variable" side and the other side will be the "constant" side. In this example, we choose the left side as the "variable" side.
speech: Choose a side to be the "variable" side and the other side will be the "constant" side. In this example, we choose the left side as the "variable" side.
pacedSpeech: Choose a side to be the "variable" side and the other side will be the "constant" side. In this example, we choose the left side as the "variable" side.

title: Subtraction property of equality
text: When you subtract the same quantity from both sides of an equation, you still have equality.
speech: When you subtract the same quantity from both sides of an equation, you still have equality.
pacedSpeech: When you subtract the same quantity from both sides of an equation, you still have equality.

title: Subtraction
speech: Subtract  3 fourths m  from each side.

title: Addition property of equality
text: When you add the same quantity to both sides of an equation, you still have equality.
speech: When you add the same quantity to both sides of an equation, you still have equality.
pacedSpeech: When you add the same quantity to both sides of an equation, you still have equality.

title: Addition
text: Add $$7$$ to each side of the equation.
speech: Add  7  to each side of the equation.
pacedSpeech: to each side of the equation.

title: Verification
text: Check whether the result is a solution of the equation.
speech: Check whether the result is a solution of the equation.
pacedSpeech: Check whether the result is a solution of the equation.

title: Verification
speech: Check whether  7 fourths times negative 6, minus, 7  equals , 3 fourths times negative 6 minus 13 .
